cell.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the smallest part of a living thing that can exist independently
cell.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Embryos grow by cell division (=the splitting of cells).
cell.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a small room in a prison or police station where prisoners are kept
cell.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: He spent a night in the cells at the local police station.
the walls of his prison cell
cell.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a cellular phone; a telephone that you can carry around with you, that works by using a network of radio stations to pass on signals
cell.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Call me on my cell if youâ€™re running late.
cell.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a piece of equipment for producing electricity from chemicals, heat, or light
cell.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: a car powered by electric fuel cells
cell.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a small group of people who are working secretly as part of a larger political organization
cell.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a small room in a monastery or convent where someone sleeps
cell.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a small space that an insect or other small creature has made to live in or use
cell.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: No new brain cells are produced after birth.
The red cells carry the oxygen.
In leukaemia there is an abnormal and excessive formation of white cells.
Every living cell has a nucleus.
The test enables doctors to detect abnormal cells.
Stem cells may make life-saving treatment possible.
Already there are many treatments which destroy cancer cells.
The embryo grows by cell division.
A healthy person' s red cell count is close to 1,000.
